artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Author: Kikubatei Rokō; Publisher: Daikokuya Kinnosuke
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 134.8; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 288.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: ink drawing on thin paper with touches of red and yellow; pair of figures wrestling in foreground--a man wearing and a demon-like figure; demon seated in background at left wearing draping garment, with a droopy face with open mouth and a second face on stomach, with PL arm stretched upward; skeletons in background behind seated demon; flowered curtain at right; patterned flooring in foreground; unsigned
portfolio: From One Hundred Tales from Japan and China (Wakan hyaku monogatari 和漢百物語)
title: Keyblock drawing for "Toki Daishirō"
